title: Bills score 16 unanswered late to shock Ravens
content: Josh Allen led Buffalo on three scoring drives in the final four minutes, the last a 32-yard field goal by Matt Prater as time expired, and the Bills rallied from 15 points down to stun the Baltimore Ravens 41-40 in a season-opening Sunday night thriller.

title: Jackson shoves fan in retaliation in Ravens' loss
content: During Sunday night's 41-40 loss to the Buffalo Bills in the season opener, Baltimore Ravens quarterback Lamar Jackson shoved a fan who slapped Jackson on the helmet. "I just let my emotions get the best of me," Jackson later told reporters.

title: Daboll noncommittal on Giants QB for Week 2
content: Giants coach Brian Daboll was hardly definitive on his QB situation entering Week 2 following Sunday's loss to the Commanders, one that saw Russell Wilson struggle throughout.

title: 49ers extend RT McKivitz with 3-year, $45M deal
content: The 49ers and right tackle Colton McKivitz have come to terms on a three-year, $45 million contract that includes $27 million guaranteed, agents Doug Hendrickson and CJ LaBoy told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Parsons gets sack, brings heat in Packers debut
content: Less than two weeks after being traded to Green Bay, Micah Parson got his first sack and was second on the team with three pressures during Sunday's win versus Detroit.

title: Alcaraz bests Sinner to win US Open, sixth Slam
content: Carlos Alcaraz reasserted his superiority over Jannik Sinner with a 6-2, 3-6, 6-1, 6-4 win Sunday in the US Open final -- the third Grand Slam tournament in a row in which these rivals met to decide a champion -- for his second title at Flushing Meadows.

title: UCLA suspends backup QB Clarkson after arrest
content: UCLA backup quarterback Pierce Clarkson was arrested on an unspecified felony charge Friday and has been indefinitely suspended from the team.

title: Barnwell separates fact from fiction off NFL Week 1: Is it too early to worry about the Lions?
content: Let's size up the legitimacy of the Lions' offensive woes, two run-game surges, Aaron Rodgers' big day and the Dolphins' ineptitude in Week 1.

title: Real or not? 14 contenders, 14 reasons they can -- or can't? -- win the World Series
content: Lack of power? Bullpen holes? Injured stars? Why each contender's biggest weakness will -- or won't -- sink them in October.

title: Three young arms are here to carry the Mets into October
content: The rookie trio of Nolan McLean, Jonah Tong and Brandon Sproat look to lift New York's fortunes this season.

title: Answering the biggest questions of Week 1: What's more jarring, the Bills' comeback or Baltimore's collapse?
content: NFL Nation reporters react to all the action, answering the biggest questions coming out of each game. Here's what we learned from Week 1.

title: Let's overreact to NFL Week 1: Which QB situations are most messy?
content: Will Jaxson Dart take Russell Wilson's job soon? Are the Dolphins doomed? We sized up Week 1 overreactions.

title: From math wiz to offensive innovator, why Bears coach Ben Johnson seemed destined for this moment
content: As Johnson prepares for his head coaching debut, those who knew him growing up aren't surprised. Here's why.

title: Eye black, meditation and Bob Marley: Inside J.J. McCarthy's game-day rituals
content: Justin Jefferson said McCarthy, who makes his NFL debut Monday against the Bears, "has the winning attitude."

title: As Carlos Alcaraz wins another US Open, can anyone challenge these Big Two?
content: With the past eight major titles, Alcaraz and Sinner are clearly dominant. Can anyone compete with them?

title: Ranking first-year WNBA coaches who have beaten -- or fallen short of -- expectations
content: Natalie Nakase has the Valkyries playoff-bound. Here's how all seven first-time WNBA head coaches have done.

title: Ranking winners, losers and injury impacts from Sunday
content: A summary of Week 1's best and worst fantasy performances, biggest storylines and historical perspective.

title: Nine months to the World Cup: Does Pochettino know his best XI?
content: If Pochettino doesn't know his USMNT XI, is he willing to commit to one soon before he runs out of time ahead of the World Cup?

title: One year after Canada's Olympics cheating scandal, the once-renowned program moves on
content: It's been about a year since Canada was accused of cheating at the Olympics. With a new coach and lofty goals for the 2027 Women's World Cup, players are still trying to move on.

title: Canelo Alvarez vs. Terence Crawford: All you need to know about Saturday's fight
content: Andreas Hale explains why Canelo Alvarez and Terence Crawford are fighting, what it means for boxing and more.

title: McLaren walking 'fairness' tightrope with Norris, Piastri
content: Sunday showed where the limitations are in McLaren's handling of the Lando Norris-Oscar Piastri rivalry.

title: True or false? What we think we know about SEC QBs, the Big 12, Oregon and more
content: The start of the 2025 season has been a delightful mess. Bill Connelly tries to make sense of what we've seen.

title: NFL draft risers, questions and notes from Kiper, Miller and Reid: Early concerns around top QBs?
content: John Mateer rising? Questions around LaNorris Sellers and Cade Klubnik? We have updates on NFL draft prospects through CFB Week 2.

title: Betting buzz: Sunday under-whelming for sportsbooks, bettors
content: The Jets-Steelers game was the exception in the NFL on Sunday when almost every game went under the point total.

title: NWSL Power Rankings: Dash making moves with playoffs looming
content: Hot off the back of a convincing 3-0 win in San Diego, Houston are streaking up ESPN's latest NWSL Power Rankings.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid eye Konate, Upamecano as free agents
content: Real Madrid are looking at Bayern Munich's Dayot Upamecano and Liverpool's Ibrahima Konaté. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 'It's blood money': Trump aide Navarro continues anti-India rant; attacks X again
content: Peter Navarro has intensified his criticism of India, accusing the nation of funding Russia's war through oil purchases. This tirade followed X's fact-checking of Navarro's post, which labeled India's actions as "blood money." Navarro's remarks have sparked controversy, with fact-checkers highlighting the US's own imports of Russian goods.

title: Bihar SIR: Consider Aadhaar, SC tells EC; clarifies it's not a citizenship proof
content: The Supreme Court has directed the Election Commission to explore including Aadhaar as a valid identity document for Bihar's Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls. The court emphasized that Aadhaar should serve solely as proof of identity, not citizenship, ensuring only genuine citizens participate in voting.

title: 'Friend shot in head': Nepal protests turn deadly; eyewitnesses recount clash
content: Massive protests erupted in Kathmandu against the government's social media ban, leading to violent clashes between police and demonstrators. Protesters, demanding the restoration of access to platforms like Facebook and Instagram, faced police aggression, resulting in nine deaths and numerous injuries.

title: Social media ban in Nepal: At least 19 dead as youths clash with police
content: Thousands of young Nepalis protested in Kathmandu against the government's ban on 26 social media platforms, leading to clashes with police and multiple casualties. Demonstrators expressed anger over the blackout and broader frustration with corruption, chanting slogans and attempting to storm the Parliament. The government imposed curfews and justified the ban by citing non-compliance with local registration requirements.

title: In pics: $100 chicken nuggets, $23 cocktails at US Open
content: The US Open has evolved into a high-end lifestyle event, where extravagant food and drinks, like the $23 Honey Deuce and $100 caviar-topped chicken nuggets, overshadow the tennis itself. This "funflation" phenomenon sees attendees splurging on experiences, turning the tournament into a spectacle of consumption and Instagrammable moments, blurring the line between sport and cultural festival.

title: Intel CEO tightens reins: No big design without his OK; sends message to staff
content: Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan has initiated a hands-on leadership policy, personally reviewing and approving major chip designs before tape-out. This move aims to enhance execution, reduce costs, and regain competitiveness after a significant financial loss. The policy is part of a broader strategy to streamline operations and strengthen Intel's product roadmap amid pressure from competitors like TSMC.

title: VP polls: 25 legal luminaries criticise Reddy-Lalu meet; call it 'dismaying'
content: A group of legal experts has strongly criticized opposition vice-presidential candidate B. Sudershan Reddy for meeting with Lalu Prasad Yadav, a politician convicted in a major corruption case. They argue that this association raises concerns about Reddy's judgment and his commitment to national interests, especially given his aspirations for high office.

title: Hazratbal row: BJP targets Rahul after Cong MP's 'what's done is done' remark
content: Following the defacement of the National Emblem in Jammu & Kashmir, a political storm has erupted. Congress leader Tariq Anwar's dismissive remark, "What's done is done," drew sharp criticism from the BJP, who accused the Congress of supporting anti-national acts. Anwar defended his statement by referencing Omar Abdullah's assertion that religious sites don't feature the Ashok Chakra.

title: Apple event tomorrow: iPhone 17, AirPods Pro 3, Apple Watch Ultra 3; everything expected
content: Apple's biggest product launch of the year – the unveiling of new iPhones and more – is set for September 9. The Cupertino giant is highly expected to reveal the iPhone 17 series at the "Awe Dropping" event, marking a significant departure from recent iPhone designs. The iPhone 17 lineup will include four models – iPhone 17, iPhone 17 Air, iPhone 17 Pro, and iPhone 17 Pro Max – alongside new Apple Watches and AirPods. Here's everything we know about Apple's upcoming hardware showcase.

title: Massive outrage in Nepal: 26 apps blocked including Facebook, WhatsApp - full list of banned apps
content: Nepal is facing widespread protests following the government's ban on 26 social media platforms, including Facebook, YouTube and X, due to non-compliance with registration rules. Demonstrations erupted over corruption allegations and the social media restrictions, resulting in clashes with police, leading to casualties and injuries. Prime Minister Oli defended the ban, prioritizing national independence over potential job losses.

title: Birthday party shame: MP cops filmed dancing with women performers
content: In Datia, an ASI was suspended after a video showed him dancing objectionably with women at a constable's birthday party. Similarly, in Shivpuri, another ASI faced suspension for dancing with a wanted criminal and a woman, with a beer can visible in the video. Both incidents have prompted investigations and potential further disciplinary actions.

title: Asia Cup 2025: Ex-batter issues warning — 'India need a new winning combination'
content: Former India cricketer Mohammad Kaif has cautioned that India might face challenges in the Asia Cup 2025 due to the absence of a third all-rounder. He emphasised the importance of having multiple all-rounders, recalling India's T20 World Cup victory where Hardik Pandya, Axar Patel, and Ravindra Jadeja provided crucial balance.

title: Red Sea cables cut: Microsoft updates; why the route is critical for Asia, Mideast
content: Undersea cable cuts in the Red Sea have significantly disrupted internet services across regions including India, Saudi Arabia, Pakistan, and the UAE, causing slowed connectivity and increased latency. The disruptions, attributed to failures affecting the SMW4 and IMEWE cable systems near Jeddah, Saudi Arabia, highlight the Red Sea's critical role in global internet data flow, impacting cloud and network services.

title: Who is Decarlos Brown Jr? Homeless offender charged in killing of Ukrainian refugee
content: Iryna Zarutska, a Ukrainian refugee seeking safety in the US, was fatally stabbed on a Charlotte light rail. Decarlos Brown Jr., a homeless man with a history of violent crime, has been charged with her murder. The incident has sparked outrage and criticism, raising concerns about public safety and the handling of repeat offenders.

title: J&K encounter: Two terrorists killed; soldier hurt in gunfight
content: A joint operation by the Army, CRPF, and J&K Police in Kulgam's Guddar forest led to an encounter with terrorists following specific intelligence inputs. The gunfight resulted in the elimination of two terrorists, while a junior commissioned officer sustained injuries during the exchange.

title: Aryna Sabalenka reigns again: Wins 2nd US Open; gets another custom WWE belt
content: Aryna Sabalenka secured her second straight US Open title in 2025, defeating Amanda Anisimova. This victory marks her fourth major title, adding to her previous Australian Open wins. Celebrating her triumph, Sabalenka received a custom WWE belt, a repeat gift from her 2024 win. She avenged her Wimbledon loss against Anisimova, showcasing her dominance in women's tennis.

title: Aaron Rodgers' love life: Shailene Woodley to Munn; what went wrong?
content: Shailene Woodley, Olivia Munn, and Danica Patrick, former partners of Aaron Rodgers, have recently shared their challenging experiences in relationships with him. Woodley described feeling lost and battling depression, while Munn felt trapped in a tumultuous family dynamic. Patrick characterized her relationship with Rodgers as emotionally abusive, highlighting the significant impact it had on her self-confidence and well-being.

title: Shilpa on Alia, Suhana; fans react to Arijit’s abrupt London show end: Top 5 news
content: Shilpa Shirodkar appreciates Alia Bhatt and calls Suhana Khan 'pretty'. Daboo Mallik addresses his rift with Amaal Mallik. Arijit Singh's London show ends abruptly due to curfew. A photo from Shah Rukh Khan's 'King' leaks, revealing Suhana Khan's look. Kajol wishes Asha Bhosle a happy birthday with a throwback photo featuring Saif Ali Khan. These events are creating buzz.

title: Crippling Russia's economy: EU explores new sanctions; joint action with US mulled
content: The EU is contemplating a 19th round of sanctions targeting Russian banks and energy firms to pressure Putin over Ukraine. These measures may include restrictions on payment systems, cryptocurrency exchanges, and oil commerce. The EU aims to align with the US, which is also considering actions like sanctions on Russia's oil tanker fleet.

title: 'Treated me like a kid': Gayle reveals painful IPL exit; says he walked out
content: Chris Gayle revealed his disillusionment and depression during his time with Punjab Kings in the IPL, feeling disrespected despite his contributions to the league. He recounted a tearful conversation with Anil Kumble and his decision to leave the team midway through the 2021 season, prioritizing his mental health over money.

title: MP man floats ‘dead’ in pond for 20 minutes; jolts back to life as cops rush in
content: In a bizarre incident at Veerpur Dam, Gwalior, a man named Tinku Singh staged his own drowning for an Instagram reel, fooling onlookers and prompting a police response. Singh lay motionless in the water for 20 minutes, leading people to believe he was dead.

title: Maharashtra polls 'stolen' claim: Cong alleges Trai blocked SMS outreach; regulator denies claim
content: Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (Trai) has denied Congress's allegation of rejecting their SMS application regarding a documentary on the Maharashtra 2024 elections. Trai clarified that it doesn't approve individual SMS templates and the rejection was by the service provider, STPL. Congress leaders criticized Trai's action, linking it to efforts to suppress information about alleged election fraud.

title: Hajj 2026 in Oman: Registration opens soon, important dates and how to apply
content: The Ministry of Endowments and Religious Affairs in Oman has opened Hajj registration for the 1447 AH (2026) season from September 23 to October 8. Citizens and residents aged 18 and above can apply online through www.hajj.om. Selection is automatic based on Saudi Arabia’s quota. Applicants will be notified via SMS in October and November, with strict guidelines to ensure a smooth process.

title: Asia Cup 2025: 'He is most dangerous as opener'- Ravi Shastri backs Samson at the top
content: Shubman Gill's inclusion as vice-captain adds complexity to India's T20I top-order selection for the Asia Cup. While Gill's Test success highlights his leadership potential, Sanju Samson's impressive opening form, including three centuries and a high strike rate, makes him a strong contender. Ravi Shastri advocates for Samson to continue opening, emphasizing his game-changing ability at the top.

title: A'ja Wilson sets WNBA record: Surpasses Moore, Loyd; Aces defeat Sky
content: A'ja Wilson's record-breaking 31-point performance propelled the Las Vegas Aces to their 15th consecutive win against the Chicago Sky, further solidifying her MVP candidacy. Wilson surpassed Jewell Loyd and Maya Moore for most 30-point games in a season. The Aces' dominant victory, coupled with contributions from Jackie Young and Chelsea Gray, underscores their readiness for a strong title defense.

title: Mumbai horror: Man kills sister’s boyfriend in Malad, surrenders at police station
content: Ashish Shetty, a 21-year-old choreographer, surrendered to Malwani Police after allegedly murdering Nitin Solanki, his sister's boyfriend. Shetty discovered Solanki's three-year relationship with his sister and, shockingly, a separate relationship with his mother.

title: Dezz vs RaKai: From homophobic slur outrage to streaming chaos
content: During Kai Cenat's Mafiathon 3 subathon, a dispute between Dezz and RaKai erupted live, escalating quickly. RaKai accused Dezz of making threats, while Dezz responded with a homophobic slur, prompting Kai Cenat to end the stream. Dezz has since apologized, but RaKai remains silent, leaving fans to speculate about the future of their relationship.

title: Noida teen batters father to death with brick, then goes to sleep
content: In a shocking incident in Noida's Safrabad, a 19-year-old, Uday, allegedly murdered his father, Gautam, following a dispute over property. Intoxicated at the time, Uday reportedly bludgeoned Gautam with a brick after the father refused to transfer ownership of a shop. The crime came to light when Gautam's brother discovered the body.

title: Which Indian tech jobs are at risk and who could gain?
content: Peter Navarro's endorsement of tariffs on outsourcing has sparked concerns in India's IT sector, potentially impacting the $283-billion industry. The debate, fueled by right-wing commentators, raises the possibility of US companies reducing outsourcing to India. This shift could lead to hiring freezes and slower promotions for Indian tech professionals, while those with specialized skills may gain.

title: Who is Bhanu Tatak and why did immigration block her travel to Ireland?
content: Anti-dam activist Bhanu Tatak was stopped at Delhi airport due to a lookout circular linked to pending police cases in Arunachal Pradesh. These cases involve alleged criminal trespass in 2021 and financing vandalism in 2022, claims she denies, alleging harassment for her opposition to hydropower projects. The incident has sparked political controversy, with accusations of silencing dissent.

title: 'Adequate food, attached toilet': How India plans to keep Choksi in Mumbai jail; all you need to know
content: The Indian government has assured Belgian authorities of humane detention conditions for Mehul Choksi if he's extradited to India for the PNB fraud case. These assurances, detailing facility specifications and healthcare provisions at Mumbai's Arthur Road Jail, aim to meet international human rights standards.

title: Arijit Singh's London show cut short: Stadium abruptly cuts power; fans react
content: Arijit Singh's London concert at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium ended abruptly, sparking online reactions. Despite a mesmerizing performance featuring hits like 'Saiyaara' and 'Jhoome Jo Pathaan,' the show was allegedly cut short due to curfew restrictions.

title: San Jose jewel heist: Car rams into jewellery store, masked mob storms inside - watch
content: In San Jose, a shocking smash-and-grab robbery targeted Kim Hung Jewellery, leaving the 88-year-old owner injured after masked suspects rammed a car into the store. The brazen daylight heist involved over a dozen individuals who looted the shop, assaulting the owner in the process. Police are investigating the armed robbery as the suspects remain at large, and the community grapples with concerns over safety.

title: Vande Bharat sleeper: New train may run from Delhi; launch in coming weeks
content: Indian Railways is set to launch its first Vande Bharat sleeper train in the coming weeks, aiming to provide a faster and more comfortable travel experience than the Rajdhani Express. The initial service is expected to operate from Delhi to destinations around 1,000 kilometers away, such as Ahmedabad, Bhopal, and Patna.

title: 'Entered via donkey route': Haryana man killed in US for objecting to public urination
content: Kapil, a 26-year-old Indian security guard from Haryana, was fatally shot in California after confronting a man for public urination. He had traveled to the US via the "donkey route" two and a half years ago. The village is in mourning and supporting the family, who are seeking government assistance to bring his body back to India.

title: UP man killed by wife, lover using drug-laced tea; buried in backyard
content: In Kanpur, Lakshmi and her lover Amit Singh are arrested. They are accused of murdering Lakshmi's husband, Shivbeer Singh. Shivbeer was allegedly sedated and killed with a pickaxe. His body was buried in their home's backyard. Savitri Devi, Shivbeer's mother, filed a missing person complaint. Police investigation led to the exhumation of skeletal remains.

title: Megan Thee Stallion sues Adin Ross: Shocking reason revealed
content: Rapper Megan Thee Stallion has sued streamer Adin Ross. The lawsuit is regarding Ross's comments on the Tory Lanez shooting incident. Stallion's legal team accuses Ross of spreading misinformation. Ross confirmed he was served legal papers in an unusual way. A mariachi band appeared at his home to deliver the deposition.

title: Trump tariff impact: How much will India’s GDP growth be hit? What CEA said
content: Chief Economic Adviser V. Anantha Nageswaran estimates that US President Trump's 50% tariffs could reduce India's GDP growth by 0.5% to 0.6%. While the US tariffs impact export competitiveness, India's growth relies more on domestic consumption. Experts suggest the tariff impact could be limited.

title: 'Losses must be felt': Zelenskyy backs Trump tariffs on nations supporting Russia; message for India?
content: Amidst the ongoing conflict, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has endorsed the US tariffs on nations supporting Russia through trade, emphasizing that strong actions, including sanctions and trade restrictions, are crucial. He accused Putin of avoiding negotiations, attributing Russia's economic troubles to this refusal. Zelenskyy also highlighted a recent major attack on Kyiv.

title: Burhanpur: 3 injured, 7 held after stone-pelting during Hanuman Chalisa recitation
content: In Biroda village, Indore, a Hanuman Chalisa recitation was disrupted by stone-pelting, injuring at least three individuals. Police have arrested seven suspects following the incident, which occurred around 8:30 pm. Authorities, led by SP Ashutosh Bagri, have filed a case and deployed additional forces to maintain order.

title: Who is Sama Kamel? Meet the newly crowned Miss Egypt 2025
content: Crowned Miss Egypt 2025, Sama Kamel captivated the nation with a sky-blue, crystal-studded gown, a flowing satin cape, and a golden crown symbolizing ambition and triumph, while her poised presence, growing Instagram following, and trending status across search engines cemented her not just as a beauty queen, but as a rising cultural figure of elegance, strength, and aspiration

title: US scraps third-country visas: Indian students to face backlogs; tougher interviews
content: Indian students now face tougher U.S. visa rules, including the end of third-country applications and mandatory interviews, causing longer waits and uncertainty. Proposed fixed-term visas and stricter compliance requirements add to the challenges. These changes increase costs and risks for Indian families investing in U.S. education, potentially delaying academic pursuits.

title: Medical staff collect blood samples from 1,500 persons at Turakapalem
content: We deployed 50 medical teams, with three members in each team, to gather samples from the villagers, which will be analysed on 41 parameters, says District Medical and Health Officer

title: Himachal Pradesh becomes ‘fully literate State’
content: CM Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu says the literacy rate in Himachal reached 99.30%, which is higher than the national benchmark of 95% with the hill State ranking first in student-teacher ratio

title: Rain casts a shadow on Onam fete cultural procession on September 9
content: IMD issues yellow alert for heavy rains during Onam Week cultural procession in Thiruvananthapuram, featuring diverse art forms and floats.

title: Upa-Lokayukta orders criminal, departmental action in High-Level Canal employees case
content: Government settles the complainants GPF dues into their rightful accounts following the Institutions orders

title: ECI must be named and shamed for brazen non-compliance with Supreme Court directive on Aadhaar: Congress
content: The opposition party also said that history will not forgive Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar and the institution he heads

title: CM silent on culture of torture and corruption at police stations: Satheesan
content: He says government will face aggressive street protests if it attempts to protect human rights violators in the force by resorting to token suspension from service and light official reprimand

title: Grants make it a grander Pulikkali this time
content: Aids by the Union and State governments and city Corporation lift the burden off performers who once used to pawn belongings to keep the tradition alive

title: Inclusion of non-existent ‘sub-castes’ after adding Christian to them in draft list opposed
content: The Veerashaiva Lingayat Mathadeeshara Vedike has strongly condemned the Siddaramaiah-led Congress government’s move

title: Dhinakaran might have left NDA as he cannot accept Palaniswami as CM candidate: T.N. BJP leader Nainar Nagenthran
content: Everyone opposing this government should remain united. If I am asked to speak to Dhinakaran or O. Panneerselvam, I will do so (to persuade them to return to the NDA): the BJP Tamil Nadu  president

title: Tension grips Maddur as right-wing outfits protest over pelting of stones during Ganesha procession
content: Hundreds of activists from BJP as well as JD(S) joined the march called by Sangh Parivar outfits shouting slogans against the State government, despite the police announcing prohibitory orders in the town on September 8.

title: Nitish Kumar announces ₹10 lakh award for each player of India men’s hockey squad
content: The title ensured India’s direct entry into next year’s FIH World Cup to be jointly hosted by Belgium and the Netherlands from August 14 to 30

title: Hyderabad drug bust: Week-long interrogation begins, police track bigger network
content: The Maharashtra Police informed the authorities in Telangana that other firms may be engaged in similar activities, prompting further probes in Hyderabad

title: Public groups press for district status to Madanapalle
content: In the backdrop of reports over district reorganisation in Rajampet and Rayachoti of the present Annamayya district, the leaders urge the government to come out with an official announcement at the earliest on the creation of ‘Madanapalle district’

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Congress intensifies protests over alleged police custodial torture and third-degree
content: With Assembly convening on September 15, the Congress aims to weaponise the videos obtained by alleged victims via RTI to turn the tables on the ruling Left Democratic Front

title: New study calls for State-specific pension reforms in Kerala rooted in an inclusive framework and fiscal sustainability
content: Public pensions in an ageing state: Is sustainability at risk? has been published in the latest issue of Kerala Economy journal published by GIFT, Thiruvananthapuram

title: Why Nepal Banned Social Media, And Why That's Not Only Trigger For Protests
content: Three people have died and more than 100 have been injured after Thousands of young Nepalese citizens hit the streets to protest the KP Sharma Oli government's move to ban 26 social media platforms, including Facebook, YouTube, and X.

title: Nepal Protest Live Updates: 19 Dead In Apps Ban Agitation, PM KP Sharma Oli's Effigy Burned
content: Live Updates: At least 19 protesters were killed after Nepal police fired rubber bullets, tear gas and water cannons to disperse demonstrators demanding the government lift its ban on social media and tackle corruption.

title: 19 Killed In Massive Nepal Protest, Social Media Ban Likely To Be Revoked
content: At least 19 people were killed in violent clashes in Nepal's Kathmandu as Gen Z protesters stormed the streets to protest over corruption and the government's social media ban.

title: Doctor Among 10 Arrested For Selling Babies Using Fake Adoption Papers In Delhi: Cops
content: A doctor was among the 10 people arrested for allegedly selling infants unwanted by their parents to childless couples for amounts ranging between Rs 1.8 lakh and Rs 7.5 lakh using forged adoption papers, police said on Monday.

title: Why The "Dean Of Valuation" Compared PM With Palantir, Trump To Tesla
content: If world leaders were stocks where would US President Donald Trump and Prime Minister Narendra Modi stand? Aswath Damodaran's engaging views have struck a chord on social media.

title: "Revision Every Few Years Is Essential": Shashi Tharoor Amid Voter List Row
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Sunday said the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) exercise being conducted by the Election Commission of India (ECI) was "essential," as electoral rolls were not perfect.

title: Amid Nepal's Social Media Ban, A Global Look at App Restrictions
content: With flags waving and chants echoing through the streets, Nepal's Gen Z has taken a stand against the government's social media ban.

title: Man, 19, Kills Father Over Property Dispute In Noida, Sleeps Next To Body: Cops
content: A 19-year-old youth was arrested for allegedly killing his father with a brick following a property dispute and slept next to the body throughout the night, police said on Monday.

title: Gurugram Woman Loses Rs 5.85 Crore In Cyber Scam, Blames Banks
content: A Gurugram woman who lost Rs 5.85 crore in a "digital arrest" scam is now asking questions of her banks that cleared the transfers.

title: 4-Year-Old Boy Dies After Balcony Collapses In Delhi's Narela
content: A four-year-old boy died on Monday after a portion of a balcony collapsed while he was playing underneath it in Outer North Delhi's Narela area, an official of the Delhi Fire Services said.

title: 2 Police Officers Killed, 1 Missing As Car Falls Into Madhya Pradesh River
content: At least three police officers, including Unhel police station in-charge Ashok Sharma, drowned after their car fell into the Shipra River in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain on Saturday.

title: Video: Masked Thieves Rob Jewellery Shop In Jharkhand, Thrash Staff
content: Five armed and masked robbers carried out a heist at a jewellery shop in Jharkhand, decamping with gold, silver and cash.

title: 15-Year-Old Girl Swept Away While Crossing River In Uttarkashi
content: A 15-year-old girl crossing the Tons river by a trolley on Monday morning fell into it and was swept away by its strong currents.

title: Opinion: Opinion | The Story Of How Sikhs Came To Own A Pro Football Club In UK
content: Morecambe FC, known as the Shrimps, more famous for pies than for points, has just been saved by the Panjab Warriors, a Sikh-led consortium that has pulled the club back from the brink.

title: 5-Year-Old Accidentally Shoots Himself While Playing With Pistol At Home In Rajasthan
content: A 5-year-old died after he pulled the trigger of a pistol while playing with it in his home in the Kotputli district of Rajasthan on Sunday.

title: Engineering Student Attacks Professor With Knife On College Campus In Andhra
content: An engineering student at Nuzvid IIIT in Eluru district of Andhra Pradesh attacked his department professor, Gopal Raju, with a knife, said the police.

title: Why Lalbaugcha Raja Immersion Was Delayed By 13 Hours, Traditions Broken
content: The immersion of Mumbai's iconic and oldest Lalbaugcha Raja Ganesh idol at Girgaon Chowpatty witnessed a delay of nearly 13 hours this year.

title: Telecom Regulator TRAI Denies Congress' Charge It Blocked SMS Outreach
content: The Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) has rejected claims from the Congress party that it blocked an SMS campaign linked to a documentary about electoral wrongdoing in the 2024 Maharashtra Assembly elections.

title: Pics: Army, Navy Conduct Diving Training At 17,000 Feet In Sikkim
content: The Indian Army's para special forces and Navy's marine commandos Marcos conducted a week-long joint scuba and combat diving exercise in chilling conditions at an altitude of 17,000 feet in Sikkim, a Defence official said on Monday.

title: After Yellow Line, focus shifts to Pink Line of Namma Metro, set to open in two phases by 2026
content: Officials pointed out that civil construction has been completed for the elevated portion, while work on stations continues in the underground segment

title: BRS to abstain from poll to elect new Vice President
content: Party’s working president KTR says PCC chief admitted about defection of BRS MLAs to Congress during a TV debate

title: Bangladeshi woman who escaped from prostitution racket rescued by Bengaluru police
content: The victim told the police that she was lured by a gang promising her a decent job as a beauty parlour staff for a salary of ₹15,000 to ₹20,000 a month and was brought to the city from Dhaka along with several others.

title: 517 villages in Tamil Nadu are seemai karuvelam-free: Tamil Nadu government tells Madras High Court
content: Justices N. Sathish Kumar and D. Bharatha Chakravarthy ask the government to come up with a plan to eradicate the exotic and invasive species completely in at least one district on a pilot basis

title: Newborn dies after home delivery in Idukki
content: Police say the couple chose not to seek medical help and the father, a pastor, assisted with the delivery. The mother had heavy bleeding and was hospitalised

title: Use of unfair means: You are destroying entire system of public exams, Supreme Court tells accused
content: The petitioner and others were booked on a complaint filed by a school principal for the alleged offences under the provisions of the BNS and the Uttar Pradesh Public Examination (Prevention of Unfair Means) Act

title: Bengaluru airport gets another hoax bomb threat mail
content: The Airport Police registered an FIR against the email user identified as thozhar_leelavathy@outlook.com, and charged the person under several sections of BNS.

title: Kerala State Teachers’ Award announced
content: Awards will be given away in various categories at a function in Thiruvananthapuram on Wednesday. The Prof. Joseph Mundassery Memorial Literary Awards have also been announced

title: PM Modi to inaugurate combined commanders' conference of armed forces in Kolkata on September 15
content: “The conference will focus on reforms, transformation and change and operational preparedness,” an official statement said

title: Tamil Valarchi Kazhagam to make Tamil content searchable for AI tools
content: The Tamil Valarchi Kazhagam, which steps into its 80th year later this month, was established by former Education Minister T.S. Avinashilingam Chettiar in 1946

title: Bhupen Hazarika’s birth centenary celebrations begin in Assam
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah paid rich tributes to the legendary singer-composer

title: Jharkhand: Month-old baby sold by parents for ₹50,000, rescued
content: The father sold his son to a tout couple from a neighbouring village as he did not have money to make ends meet or to treat his wife who has been unwell since the delivery

title: Y.S. Sharmila’s son Raja Reddy makes first public appearance, hints at political entry in Andhra Pradesh
content: Seen as the next-generation heir of YSR’s legacy, Raja Reddy’s entry comes amid Sharmila–Jagan rift; Congress leader also presses for higher onion MSP in Kurnool

title: Madras High Court directs Tiruppur SP to monitor investigation into alleged dowry death of newly married woman
content: Justice N. Sathish Kumar issues the direction while disposing of a plea by her father to transfer the investigation to some other agency

title: Officers acting against LDF’s police policy will face punishment, says CPI leader Binoy Viswam
content: Alappuzha all set to host the State conference of the Communist Party of India. The torch relay rally to the venue of the delegates’ conference will commence from Vayalar Martyrs’ Memorial  at 2 p.m. on Tuesday (September 9)

title: Student attacks faculty with knife at Nuzvid IIIT in Andhra Pradesh; case booked
content: M. Tech student, Vinay Kumar, attacked Prof. Gopala Raju, when he refused to allow him into the examination hall

title: Case registered against BJP leaders on charge of protesting at Kannur’s Madayipara
content: The case was registered under sections of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita for obstructing public transport on the Madayipara road and raising provocative slogans allegedly intended to create social unrest

title: Autorickshaw driver pushes friend to death under train in Bengaluru
content: Ismail allegedly used to talk to Pratap’s female friend over the phone frequently, leading to arguments between them.

title: Forest Department’s special highway patrol team drives away elephants to prevent interceptions of sugarcane-laden lorries in Erode
content: Sugarcane cultivated in Thalavadi and Karnataka’s Chamarajanagar district is transported daily by lorries to a private sugar mill in Sathyamangalam. Since the harvesting season began last month, interceptions by elephants have become frequent.

title: Elgar Parishad case: Supreme Court to hear bail plea of activist Mahesh Raut on September 15
content: Mr. Raut’s counsel apprised the top court that he has been suffering from rheumatoid arthritis and required urgent medical attention

title: A total of 18 Bangladeshi infiltrators sent back from Assam: CM Himanta Biswa Sarma
content: Sribhumi, Cachar, Dhubri, and South Salmara-Mankachar districts share 267.5 km of International Border with Bangladesh

title: BJD MPs to abstain from voting in vice-presidential elections
content: BJD MP Sasmit Patra said that the BJD maintains an equal distance from both the NDA and the INDIA bloc

title: Edappadi Palaniswami’s loyalist in Salem alleges death threats from AIADMK MLA Sengottaiyan’s supporters
content: On September 4 and 5, the loyalist took part in a television debate and made remarks about Mr. Sengottaiyan, after which he started to receive calls allegedly from Mr. Sengottaiyan’s supporters and they claimed to kill him and also threatened to hurl bombs at Mr. Palaniswami’s house too

title: Meet the pickle-preneurs of Kolar, Karnataka’s mango capital
content: Rathnamma A.V., a homemaker and a member of Women’s Farmer Producer Organisation from Kolar’s Srinivaspur taluk, started a small mango pickle-making unit in 2017 with 10 members producing 50 kg of pickle a month. Today, she has a 50-person team and produces 2,000 kg of pickle a month.

title: Bomb threat triggers searches at Kerala CM’s official residence, court complex
content: Threat message, which references certain issues related to Tamil Nadu politics, was received via e-mail addressed to Thiruvananthapuram District Court

title: Bihar CM hikes stipend for anganwadi workers and helpers
content: According to sources in the State government, there are more than 1.20 lakh anganwadi workers and helpers in Bihar who stand to benefit from the hike in stipends

title: Kerala to challenge Supreme Court ruling on Teachers’ Eligibility Test
content: Education Minister V. Sivankutty says Supreme Court’s judgment can adversely affect as many as 50,000 teachers in Kerala

title: SC issues notice to ED, Gujarat on journalist Mahesh Langa’s bail plea
content: Kapil Sibal, for Mahesh Langa, argues the cases lodged against his client were based on baseless allegations

title: SC judge Chandran recuses from hearing plea seeking probe into U.S. short seller's allegations against Vedanta
content: Taking note of Justice Chandran's recusal, the Bench also comprising Chief Justice of India B. R. Gavai and Atul Chandurkar adjourned the plea filed by advocate Shakti Bhatia

title: Madras High Court stays order directing Junior Vikatan top brass to pay ₹25 lakh compensation to DMK MP T.R. Baalu in defamation suit
content: Justices S.M. Subramaniam and C. Saravanan grant the interim stay following an appeal filed against the single judge’s February 4, 2025 order

title: Voter fraud allegations in Maharashtra: Had no role to play in approving content of bulk SMS messages, says TRAI
content: TRAI was responding to the Indian National Congress’ allegation that it was stopped from sending a link to a video on allegations of voter fraud in Maharashtra

title: Bengaluru boy hits head on overhead barrier while standing through car sunroof
content: Since the car was moving slowly, the boy, who was traveling with his family, had a narrow escape with no fatal injuries.

title: Tribal outfit claims rats bit 4 fingers of newborn girl, accuses Indore hospital of ‘cover-up’
content: Tribal group demands action after newborns die from rat bites in hospital; officials face culpable homicide charges

title: Brain-eating amoeba: Kerala reports fifth amoebic meningoencephalitis death in a month
content: Deceased is a Wayanad native. Presently, 11 persons are undergoing treatment for the disease at Kozhikode Medical College Hospital

title: Supreme Court asks UPSC, T.N. to consider names for regular DGP ‘expeditiously’
content: A Bench headed by Chief Justice of India B.R. Gavai directed the UPSC and the State to consider the names and make the appointment of regular DGP expeditiously

title: Supreme Court refuses to intervene in plea challenging the appointment of first woman V-C for Aligarh Muslim University
content: The Bench said it was not inclined to entertain the petition raising questions about the selection process; the Allahabad HC had earlier found nothing wrong in Prof. Naima Khatoon’s appointment

title: Madras High Court restrains Ajith Kumar-starrer ‘Good Bad Ugly’ producer from exhibiting movie with Ilaiyaraaja’s songs
content: Justice N. Senthilkumar grants the ex-parte interim injunction after stating that Mythri Movie Makers had given a “bald” reply to the composer’s legal notice

title: Kerala State Beverages Corporation registers record ₹970.74 crore in liquor sales during Onam
content: Kerala State Beverages Corporation records a growth of 9.34% in sales revenue compared to the previous year's sales during the Onam season, which was ₹842.07 crore

title: Landslip blocks rail route in Haridwar, movement of trains affected
content: Movement of trains on the route, including the Vande Bharat Express, has been suspended for the time being as the debris clearance is likely to take 8-10 hours

title: Enforce GR; start giving Kunbi certificates to Marathas before September 17: Manoj Jarange to Maharashtra Government
content: The Kunbi is a traditional farming community in the State and they have been included in the list of OBC category in Maharashtra

title: Supreme Court dismisses Telangana BJP's plea against order quashing defamation case against CM Revanth Reddy
content: “If you are a politician, you should have thick skin to bear these things”, said a Bench headed by Chief Justice of India Bhushan R. Gavai

title: BJP counters AAP's 'Panchayat' jibe; takes 'Sunita Kejriwal' dig
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports .

title: 60K club: Matthew Stafford becomes 10th player to throw for 60,000 yards
content: Aaron Rodgers became the ninth quarterback to throw for 60,000 regular-season passing yards . he threw for 245 yards in the win against the Houston Texans . the los Angeles Rams chose to rest him ahead of their playoff run .

title: Best of NFL Week 1 tunnel fits, featuring Travis Hunter's new haircut
content: the pregame tunnel doubles as a runway for the NFL's brightest stars to make an entrance long before the first snap . veterans and rookies alike have arrived in statement looks, some pairing tailored cuts with clean sneakers and crisp knits . some keep it strictly business in classic suits, others lean casual with relaxed looks .

title: College football betting: Why Florida State should have your attention
content: the Seminoles beat the Crimson Tide 31-17 in a heavyweight matchup . it was a "program-shifting win," analysts call it a 'statement' for Mike Norvell's culture .

title: AP Week 2 poll reaction: What's next for each Top 25 team
content: four AP-ranked teams outscored their opponents by a combined 307-26 . four ranked teams scored 70 or more points, the second time in the AP poll era . it's the longest streak to begin a game in school history .

title: Breece Hall, Travis Etienne Jr. roles come into focus and other Week 1 notes
content: fantasy football buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around the NFL . RB Breece Hall leads the backfield with 145 total yards on 19 carries plus two catches for 38 yards . it was his highest number of rushing attempts since 2023 .

title: What happened to Oklahoma State? Is USF the team to watch?
content: the ACC and Big Ten show they have multiple teams in contention for the college football playoff . south Florida beat yet another AP Top 25 team and Oklahoma State suffered its biggest loss in over 100 years . our college football experts break down key takeaways from Week 2 performances .

title: Power Rankings: Close wins, areas for concern and biggest surprises
content: the limited sample size highlighted some possible concerns for contenders . LSU , Penn State and Georgia had a hard time pulling away from inferior competition in Week 2 . a last-minute defensive breakdown doomed the defending Big 12 champs against Mississippi State .

title: Which teams have clinched a playoff spot?
content: eight teams advance to the 2025 WNBA playoffs, and the bracket is filling up . the regular season wraps up Thursday, and we're tracking which teams have secured a spot in the postseason, which opens Sept. 14 . a playoff berth has been clinched for the second consecutive year .

title: 'What kind of retired SC Judge are you?': BJP attacks INDIA bloc's VP pick over meeting Lalu

title: Vrabel says Belichick welcome at Patriots facility
content: bill Belichick bans scouts at the university of north Carolina . the six-time super bowl-winning coach says he's welcome at the facility . belichick says it's "obvious I'm not welcome at their facility"

title: ✈️ Steelers' jab at Jets tops NFL Week 1 trolls
content: Steelers QB Aaron Rodgers threw for 244 yards and four touchdowns in 34-32 win . Jets quarterback Justin Fields accounted for 266 yards and three touchdowns . the Steelers also turned off the airplane mode function on an iPhone .
